data.enText: change position
to change position or make sb/sth change position in a way that can be seen, heard or felt
Don't move─stay perfectly still.

data.chText: 我跳上车的时候，公共汽车已经开动了。
data.enText: The bus was already moving when I jumped onto it.

data.chText: 他能听到楼上屋里有人走动。
data.enText: He could hear someone moving around in the room above.
Phil moved towards the window.

data.chText: 这家酒吧星期六总是挤得令人无法挪动。
data.enText: You can hardly move in this pub on Saturdays (= because it is so crowded) .

data.chText: 她的屋里书多得挪不开步。
data.enText: You can't move for books in her room.
I can't move my fingers.

data.chText: 我们把椅子挪近了一点。
data.enText: We moved our chairs a little nearer.
change ideas/time
to change; to change sth

data.chText: 政府在这个问题上没有转变。
data.enText: The government has not moved on this issue.

data.chText: 我们把开会时间改到星期三吧。
data.enText: Let's move the meeting to Wednesday.
make progress
to make progress in the way or direction mentioned
Time is moving on.

data.chText: 今天的股票价格上升了。
data.enText: Share prices moved ahead today.

data.chText: 事情的进展不像我们希望的那么快。
data.enText: Things are not moving as fast as we hoped.
take action
to take action; to do sth

data.chText: 警察迅速采取行动来消除谣言。
data.enText: The police moved quickly to dispel the rumours.
change house/job
to change the place where you live, have your work, etc.

data.chText: 我们不喜欢这地方，所以决定搬走。
data.enText: We don't like it here so we've decided to move.
The company's moving to Scotland.

data.chText: 自从她女儿搬走以后，她一直独自生活。
data.enText: She's been all on her own since her daughter moved away.
We moved house last week.
to make sb change from one job, class, etc. to another

data.chText: 我要调到纽约办事处去。
data.enText: I'm being moved to the New York office.
in board games

before.chText: 国际象棋和其他棋类游戏
before.enText: in chess and other board games

data.enText: to change the position of a piece
It's your turn to move.
She moved her queen.
cause strong feelings
to cause sb to have strong feelings, especially of sympathy or sadness

data.chText: 她的困境深深地打动了我们。
data.enText: We were deeply moved by her plight.

data.chText: 这样悲惨的场面甚至让铮铮男子潸然泪下。
data.enText: Grown men were moved to tears at the horrific scenes.
make sb do sth
to cause sb to do sth

data.chText: 她不由得想给大家讲一番话。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She felt moved to address the crowd.

data.chText: 他只有在想干活的时候才干活。
data.enText: He works when the spirit moves him (= when he wants to) .
suggest formally
to suggest sth formally so that it can be discussed and decided

data.chText: 反对派对法案提出修正案。
data.enText: The Opposition moved an amendment to the Bill.
I move that a vote be taken on this.
get moving

data.chText: 马上行动；迅速开始（或离去等）
data.enText: to begin, leave, etc. quickly
It's late─we'd better get moving.
get sth moving
to cause sth to make progress

data.chText: 新来的主任确实使事情有了进展。
data.enText: The new director has really got things moving.
move heaven and earth
to do everything you possibly can in order to achieve sth
move with the times
to change the way you think and behave according to changes in society
get your ass in gear
move your ass
a rude way of telling sb to hurry
move along

data.chText: 移动一下，向前移动（以腾出空间）
data.enText: to go to a new position, especially in order to make room for other people

data.chText: 公共汽车司机让他们往里走走。
data.enText: The bus driver asked them to move along.
move in
move into sth
to start to live in your new home

data.chText: 我们的新邻居昨天搬来了。
data.enText: Our new neighbours moved in yesterday.
move in sth

data.chText: 涉足，出入，生活在（某群体）
data.enText: to live, spend your time, etc. in a particular social group

data.chText: 她只涉足那些精英圈子。
data.enText: She only moves in the best circles.
move in (on sb/sth)
to move towards sb/sth from all directions, especially in a threatening way

data.chText: 警察从四面八方向恐怖分子进逼。
data.enText: The police moved in on the terrorists.
move in with sb
to start living with sb in the house or flat/apartment where they already live
move off
to start moving; to leave
move on (to sth)
to start doing or discussing sth new

data.chText: 这工作我已经干得够久了——我该干点别的了。
data.enText: I've been in this job long enough─it's time I moved on.

data.chText: 我们可以接着讨论下一项议程吗？
data.enText: Can we move on to the next item on the agenda?
move sb on

data.chText: 让（某人）离开（事故现场等）
data.enText: to order sb to move away from the scene of an accident, etc.
move out
to leave your old home
move over
move up
to change your position in order to make room for sb

data.chText: 如果你挪开一点，这里还可以容纳多一个人。
data.enText: There's room for another one if you move up a bit.
action
an action that you do or need to do to achieve sth

data.chText: 政府最近采取的行动引起了强烈的反对。
data.enText: This latest move by the government has aroused fierce opposition.

data.chText: 资方没有采取任何措施来解决罢工问题。
data.enText: The management have made no move to settle the strike.

data.chText: 找份市场营销的工作是一个不错的职业选择。
data.enText: Getting a job in marketing was a good career move .
change of position
a change of place or position
Don't make a move !
Every move was painful.

data.chText: 她觉得他在注意她的一举一动。
data.enText: She felt he was watching her every move .
change of ideas/behaviour
a change in ideas, attitudes or behaviour

data.chText: 人们对于原子能的看法已经转变。
data.enText: There has been a move away from nuclear energy.
change of house/job
an act of changing the place where you live or work
What's the date of your move?

data.chText: 他们从意大利迁到美国并不成功。
data.enText: Their move from Italy to the US has not been a success.

data.chText: 她的新工作只是平级调动。
data.enText: Her new job is just a sideways move.
in board games
an act of changing the position of a piece in chess or other games that are played on a board

data.chText: 这盘棋只走了六步就结束了。
data.enText: The game was over in only six moves.
It's your move.
be on the move
to be travelling from place to place
to be moving; to be going somewhere
The car was already on the move.

data.chText: 公司正在迁往更大的办公区。
data.enText: The firm is on the move to larger offices.

data.text: = be on the go at go n.

data.enText: get a move on
you tell sb to get a move on when you want them to hurry
make the first move

data.chText: 抢先行动；抢占先机；主动示好
data.enText: to do sth before sb else, for example in order to end an argument or to begin sth

data.chText: 他要是想见我，就得采取主动。
data.enText: If he wants to see me, he should make the first move.
make a move
to begin a journey or a task

data.chText: 时间不早了——我们得动身了。
data.enText: It's getting late─we'd better make a move.
make a move on sb
to try to start a sexual relationship with sb
to try to pass sb who is in front of you in a race
make a, your, etc. move
to do the action that you intend to do or need to do in order to achieve sth

data.chText: 叛乱者一直等到夜幕降临才开始行动。
data.enText: The rebels waited until nightfall before they made their move.

data.text: action ♦ move ♦ act ♦ gesture ♦ deed ♦ feat

data.chText: 以上各词均指行为、行动。
data.enText: These are all words for a thing that sb does.
action
a thing that sb does

data.chText: 她行动迅速，救了小孩的命。
data.enText: Her quick action saved the child's life.
move

data.chText: （尤用于新闻）指为达到某目标而采取或需要采取的行动：
data.enText: (used especially in journalism) an action that you do or need to do to achieve sth

data.chText: 他们在等待民意测验的结果，然后再决定下一步行动。
data.enText: They are waiting for the results of the opinion polls before deciding their next move.
act
a thing that sb does
an act of kindness

data.chText: 这两个词意义相同，但用于不同的句型。act后常跟of，而且 / 或常与形容词连用。action通常不与of连用，但常与his、her等词连用：
data.enText: These two words have the same meaning but are used in different patterns. An act is usually followed by of and/or used with an adjective. Action is not usually used with of but is often used with his , her , etc.
a heroic act of bravery
a heroic action of bravery

data.chText: 他在战争中的英雄壮举
data.enText: his heroic actions/acts during the war
Action often combines with take but act does not.
We shall take whatever acts are necessary.
action or act?
gesture

data.chText: 指表达情感或意图的举动或言语：
data.enText: a thing that you do or say to show a particular feeling or intention

data.chText: 他们送了一些花表示慰问。
data.enText: They sent some flowers as a gesture of sympathy.
deed

data.chText: 通常指良好或不良的行为、行动：
data.enText: ( formal , literary ) a thing that sb does that is usually very good or very bad
heroic/evil deeds
feat

data.chText: 指需要技巧、气力或勇气的成就或业绩：
data.enText: ( approving ) an action or piece of work that needs skill, strength or courage

data.chText: 这条隧道是工程方面的辉煌成就。
data.enText: The tunnel is a brilliant feat of engineering.
a(n) act/gesture/feat of sth
to perform a(n) action/act/deed/feat
to make a move/gesture
a heroic/brave/daring action/move/act/gesture/deed/feat
a kind/charitable/generous action/act/gesture/deed
a(n) evil/terrible action/act/deed

ex.enText: the rocking motion of the boat

ex.chText: 这些数据是根据行星的运行而计算得出的。
ex.enText: These data are calculated based on the motion of the planets.

ex.chText: 你对永动机有什么看法？
ex.enText: What is your opinion on the perpetual motion machine?

synonyms.bx: 指某人或某物运动的过程或方式。

ex.chText: 看到信号之后，她没有再朝门口移动。
ex.enText: Seeing the signal, she made no move towards the door.

ex.chText: 桌子上的那台摄影机将会记录你的一举一动。
ex.enText: The camera on the table will record your every move.

synonyms.bx: 指朝某一方向的移动，通常用单数。

ex.chText: 观众为舞蹈演员优美的动作喝彩。
ex.enText: The audience applauded the dancer's graceful movements.

ex.chText: 窗帘稍微动了一下，暴露了他藏身的位置。
ex.enText: A slight movement of the curtains showed where he was hiding.

synonyms.bx: 多指某人或某物位置的变化。

It's late─we'd better get moving.

data.enText: She only moves in the best circles.

data.chText: 警察从四面八方向恐怖分子进逼。
data.enText: The police moved in on the terrorists.
move in with sb
to start living with sb in the house or flat/apartment where they already live
move off

move on (to sth)

data.chText: 这工作我已经干得够久了——我该干点别的了。
data.enText: I've been in this job long enough─it's time I moved on.

data.chText: 我们可以接着讨论下一项议程吗？
data.enText: Can we move on to the next item on the agenda?
move sb on

data.chText: 让（某人）离开（事故现场等）
data.enText: to order sb to move away from the scene of an accident, etc.
move out
to leave your old home
move over
move up
to change your position in order to make room for sb

data.chText: 如果你挪开一点，这里还可以容纳多一个人。
data.enText: There's room for another one if you move up a bit.

trans: （尤指被警察告知）往前走，别停留；命令…离开
（警察、士兵或袭击者）逼近，进逼
（警察等）命令…不要停留（或走开）
（结束或停下某活动）接着做其他事
（为给别人腾出空间而）变换位置，让开
（尤指为靠近他人或给他人让出空间而）挪动

tr: the act of deciding to do something
example: he didn't make a move to help
his first move was to hire a lawyer

tr: (game) a player's turn to take some action permitted by the rules of the game
the act of changing your residence or place of business
example: they say that three moves equal one fire

tr: the act of changing location from one place to another
example: police controlled the motion of the crowd
the movement of people from the farms to the cities
his move put him directly in my path

tr: a change of position that does not entail a change of location
example: the reflex motion of his eyebrows revealed his surprise
movement is a sign of life
an impatient move of his hand
gastrointestinal motility

tr: be in a state of action
example: she is always moving

tr: go or proceed from one point to another
example: the debate moved from family values to the economy

tr: progress by being changed
example: The speech has to go through several more drafts
run through your presentation before the meeting

tr: propose formally
in a debate or parliamentary meeting
have a turn
make one's move in a game
example: Can I go now?

tr: give an incentive for action
example: This moved me to sacrifice my career

tr: have an emotional or cognitive impact upon
example: This child impressed me as unusually mature
This behavior struck me as odd

tr: arouse sympathy or compassion in
example: Her fate moved us all

tr: move so as to change position, perform a nontranslational motion
example: He moved his hand slightly to the right

tr: change location
move, travel, or proceed, also metaphorically
example: How fast does your new car go?
We travelled from Rome to Naples by bus
The policemen went from door to door looking for the suspect
The soldiers moved towards the city in an attempt to take it before night fell
news travelled fast

tr: cause to move or shift into a new position or place, both in a concrete and in an abstract sense
example: Move those boxes into the corner, please
I'm moving my money to another bank
The director moved more responsibilities onto his new assistant

tr: change residence, affiliation, or place of employment
example: We moved from Idaho to Nebraska
The basketball player moved from one team to another

tr: dispose of by selling
example: The chairman of the company told the salesmen to move the computers

tr: perform an action, or work out or perform (an action)
example: think before you act
We must move quickly
The governor should act on the new energy bill
The nanny acted quickly by grabbing the toddler and covering him with a wet towel

tr: follow a procedure or take a course
example: We should go farther in this matter
She went through a lot of trouble
go about the world in a certain manner
Messages must go through diplomatic channels

tr: live one's life in a specified environment
example: she moves in certain circles only

value.def: When you move something or when it moves, its position changes and it does not remain still.

example.ex: She moved the sheaf of papers into position...
example.tran: 她把那捆报纸挪到合适的地方。

example.ex: You can move the camera both vertically and horizontally...
example.tran: 你可以上下左右移动摄像机。

example.ex: A traffic warden asked him to move his car...
example.tran: 交通管理员让他把车开走。

example.ex: I could see the branches of the trees moving back and forth...
example.tran: 我能看到树枝来回摇摆。

example.ex: The train began to move.
example.tran: 火车开动了。

value.def: When you move, you change your position or go to a different place.

example.ex: She waited for him to get up, but he didn't move...
example.tran: 她等他起床，但他没动弹。

example.ex: There was so much furniture you could hardly move without bumping into something...
example.tran: 家具太多，稍挪步就会撞到什么东西上。

example.ex: He moved around the room, putting his possessions together...
example.tran: 他在屋里走来走去，忙着把自己的东西放在一起。

example.ex: She moved away from the window.
example.tran: 她从窗边走开。

example.ex: The doctor made a move towards the door...
example.tran: 医生朝门口走去。

example.ex: Daniel's eyes followed her every move.
example.tran: 丹尼尔的目光追随着她的一举一动。

value.def: If you move, you act or you begin to do something.

example.ex: Industrialists must move fast to take advantage of new opportunities in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 实业家们必须尽快采取行动，抓住东欧的新机遇。

value.def: A move is an action that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: The one point cut in interest rates was a wise move...
example.tran: 将利率降低一个点是明智的举措。

example.ex: It may also be a good move to suggest she talks things over...
example.tran: 建议她把事情谈开了也许是不错的做法。

example.ex: The thirty-five member nations agreed to the move...
example.tran: 35个成员国同意采取该措施。

example.ex: Her latest disappearing act may be no more than a stunt, or a smart career move.
example.tran: 她最近玩消失也许只是一个噱头，或是其职业生涯上的一着妙棋。

value.def: If a person or company moves, they leave the building where they have been living or working, and they go to live or work in a different place, taking their possessions with them.

example.ex: My family home is in York-shire and they don't want to move...
example.tran: 我家人住在约克郡，他们不打算搬家。

example.ex: She had often considered moving to London...
example.tran: 她过去常想搬到伦敦去住。

example.ex: They move house fairly frequently...
example.tran: 他们搬家相当频繁。

example.ex: The London Evening Standard moved offices a few years ago.
example.tran: 《伦敦标准晚报》报址几年前迁走了。

example.ex: Modigliani announced his move to Montparnasse in 1909.
example.tran: 莫迪利亚尼1909年宣布他要移居蒙帕尔纳斯。

value.def: If people in authority move someone, they make that person go from one place or job to another one.

example.ex: His superiors moved him to another parish...
example.tran: 上级把他派往另一个教区。

example.ex: Ms Clark is still in position and there are no plans to move her...
example.tran: 克拉克女士仍然在位，没有要调动她的计划。

example.ex: The family had to be moved because of an attack on their home.
example.tran: 这家人在住处遭受袭击后，只好举家迁往别处。

value.def: If you move from one job or interest to another, you change to it.

example.ex: He moved from being an extramural tutor to being a lecturer in social history...
example.tran: 他原先是一名校外辅导老师，后调入学校讲授社会史。

example.ex: In the early days Christina moved jobs to get experience.
example.tran: 起初克里斯蒂娜更换不同的工作来积累经验。

example.ex: His move to the chairmanship means he will take a less active role in day-to-day management.
example.tran: 他调任主席职务，意味着他对日常管理工作的参与将减少。

value.def: If you move to a new topic in a conversation, you start talking about something different.

example.ex: Let's move to another subject, Dan.
example.tran: 丹，我们换个话题吧。

value.tran: 改变(谈话内容);转到（新的话题）

value.def: If you move an event or the date of an event, you change the time at which it happens.

example.ex: The club has moved its meeting to Saturday, January 22nd...
example.tran: 俱乐部把会议日期改到1月22号，星期六。

example.ex: The band have moved forward their Leeds date to October 27.
example.tran: 乐队已把去利兹的日期提前至10月27号。

value.def: If you move towards a particular state, activity, or opinion, you start to be in that state, do that activity, or have that opinion.

example.ex: The Labour Party has moved to the right and become like your Democrat Party...
example.tran: 工党已右倾化了，变得像你们民主党。

example.ex: It is already possible to start moving toward the elimination of nuclear weapons...
example.tran: 已有可能朝着消除核武器的目标努力。

example.ex: Since the Convention was drawn up international opinion has begun to move against it.
example.tran: 自从该国际公约起草之日起，国际社会就转而对其持反对意见。

example.ex: His move to the left was not a sudden leap but a natural working out of ideas.
example.tran: 他转向左派不是一种骤变，而是思想意识的自然发展。

value.def: If a situation or process is moving, it is developing or progressing, rather than staying still.

example.ex: Events are moving fast...
example.tran: 事件进展迅速。

example.ex: Someone has got to get things moving.
example.tran: 应该有人牵头把事情做起来。

value.def: If you say that you will not be moved, you mean that you have come to a decision and nothing will change your mind.

example.ex: Everyone thought I was mad to go back, but I wouldn't be moved.
example.tran: 大家都认为我回去是很不明智的，但我不会动摇。

value.def: If something moves you to do something, it influences you and causes you to do it.

example.ex: It was punk that first moved him to join a band seriously...
example.tran: 最初是朋克摇滚乐促使他正式加入了乐队。

example.ex: The president was moved to come up with these suggestions after the hearings.
example.tran: 听证会促使总统想出了这些建议。

value.def: If something moves you, it has an effect on your emotions and causes you to feel sadness or sympathy for another person.

example.ex: These stories surprised and moved me...
example.tran: 这些故事让我吃惊，也让我感动。

example.ex: His prayer moved me to tears.
example.tran: 他的祈祷把我感动得热泪盈眶。

example.ex: Those who listened to him were deeply moved.
example.tran: 听众都被他深深打动了。

value.def: If you say that someone moves in a particular society, circle, or world, you mean that they know people in a particular social class or group and spend most of their time with them.

example.ex: She moves in high-society circles in London...
example.tran: 她时常出入伦敦的上流社会。

example.ex: They moved in a world where hostility to racists was natural.
example.tran: 他们出没在一个对种族主义者的敌视习以为常的世界里。

value.tran: 活跃，出入，涉足(于某团体、领域或圈子)

value.def: At a meeting, if you move a motion, you formally suggest it so that everyone present can vote on it.

example.ex: Labour quickly moved a closure motion to end the debate...
example.tran: 工党很快提出终止辩论的动议。

example.ex: I move that the case be dismissed.
example.tran: 我提议对该案不予受理。

value.def: A move is an act of putting a chess piece or other counter in a different position on a board when it is your turn to do so in a game.

example.ex: With no idea of what to do for my next move, my hand hovered over the board.
example.tran: 我举着棋子，不知下一步该怎么走。

value.def: If you say that one false move will cause a disaster, you mean that you or someone else must not make any mistakes because the situation is so difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: He knew one false move would end in death.
example.tran: 他明白稍有差池就会被置于死地。

value.def: If you tell someone to get a move on, you are telling them to hurry.
If you make a move, you prepare or begin to leave one place and go somewhere else.

example.ex: He glanced at his wristwatch. 'I suppose we'd better make a move.'
example.tran: 他看一眼手表说：“我想我们最好动身吧。”

example.ex: He made a move to leave.
example.tran: 他起身离开。

value.def: If you make a move, you take a course of action.

example.ex: The week before the deal was supposed to close, fifteen Japanese banks made a move to pull out...
example.tran: 在预定交易就要结束的前一周，15家日本银行采取行动撤离。

example.ex: Don't wait for others to make the first move: invite friends to visit you.
example.tran: 别等别人先主动，要先邀请朋友到家来。

value.def: If you are on the move, you are going from one place to another.

example.ex: Jack never wanted to stay in one place for very long, so they were always on the move.
example.tran: 杰克从不想在一个地方呆太久，所以他们总在奔波辗转。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR after v, v-link PHR

trans: 离开；继续前进；（警察等）命令…不要停留（或走开）；（结束或停下某活动）接着做其他事
搬来；迁入；（警察、士兵或袭击者）逼近，进逼；插手；涉足
使从…中醒悟过来；从…搬走，离开…
（尤指为靠近他人或给他人让出空间而）挪动；上涨；升级；升迁
